intro: Curcuma nakhonphanomensis, commonly known as Nakhonphanom turmeric, is a rhizomatous herbaceous plant native to Thailand. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive fragrance. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to common turmeric. The botanical features of this species make it valuable for both ornamental and medicinal purposes.
